notesStmt.note: Folios 3r to 5v contain three poetical elegies.Folio 6v contains a list of accents of the three poetical books. Yehudah ben Shelomoh Yedidyah, inscribed in the contract of sale to Eliezer ben Eliyahu of Aquila, witnessed by Menaḥem ben Eliyahu of Ascoli and Yeḳutiel ben Mosheh of Sulmona, folio 86v, with a date of 226 (1465). A former owner's seal, folio 3r: Pandulphi de Ricasolio Baronibus Cano. Flor., dated 1654.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The commentary of Gersonides (Leṿi ben Gershom aka Ralbag) on the book of Proverbs, with the punctuated and accentuated biblical text.

collation.p: Quires of mostly 8 leaves each. Catchwords at the end of the quires.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian (Ashkenazi style) square and semi-cursive script, unpunctuated, of 15th century.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Thomas Rodd the younger (b. 1796, d. 1849), purchased through him on 04 December 1841, inscribed (folio 87v).
